sentences.english: Dorothea seized this as a precious permission .
sentences.chinese: 多萝西娅认为这是一个美好的允诺。

sentences.english: Suncor is promising to spend another C$1.2 billion to deal with its tailings.
sentences.chinese: 森科公司允诺再投入12亿加元进行尾矿处理。

sentences.english: You try to keep all your commitments in your head and feel overwhelmed.
sentences.chinese: 你努力记住自己作出的所有允诺，感到喘不过气。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, AI has a lot of promise on the Web.
sentences.chinese: 虽然如此，人工智能在互联网上有一大堆的允诺。

sentences.english: He promised to continue the fight against infidel forces.
sentences.chinese: 他允诺继续与无宗教信仰力量的抗争。

sentences.english: Donnot promise me forever just love me day by day.
sentences.chinese: 不用允诺永远，只消爱我一天又一天。

sentences.english: The General had promised to cede power by January.
sentences.chinese: 将军允诺于一月份之前交出兵权。

sentences.english: The role of this part is to educe the focus of this article-administration commitment system.
sentences.chinese: 这一部分的作用是引出本文的重点，即行政允诺制度。

sentences.english: Rain check:(American English) A promise that an unaccepted offer will be renewed in the future.
sentences.chinese: 一种允诺，目前无法接受的提议将来可以重新提出。

sentences.english: He stood to his offer of $100 and would not withdraw.
sentences.chinese: 他遵守提供100英镑的允诺，决不食言。

sentences.english: FAIRY】The fairy promised to grant the child's wish.
sentences.chinese: 小仙子答应允诺那孩子的希望。

sentences.english: Berman promised to introduce legislation he said would help enhance the profile of intellectual-property protections overseas.
sentences.chinese: 伯曼允诺会提出有助于巩固海外知识产权保护的法案。

sentences.english: If you promise that you love me .
sentences.chinese: 给我你的爱，承以你亲口允诺。

sentences.english: The Internet Economy promised to get rid of the middle-men and we loved it.
sentences.chinese: 互联网经济允诺要取缔中间人，我们都拥护这一点。

sentences.english: Any subject abide by its commitments and promissory estoppel.
sentences.chinese: 任何主体信守自己的承诺及允诺后不得翻供。

sentences.english: Become wise to their desires and learn to recognize their false promises.
sentences.chinese: 了解他们的欲望并学会认清他们其中错误的允诺。

definition: lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
to give a nod of approval
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to agree/to decide after consultation/to come to a compromise
